Title: ICT Granicus - Firmstep
Description:
The council has in place a number of forms packages that provide differing functionality to services and historically best fit has been used as a guide rather than overall strategic fit.

The council has been looking to find a strategic fit package for some time and has opted for Granicus Firmstep to fulfil that role. It is currently in use with Cambridgeshire County Council (CCC) and there are synergies in form usage across both authorities, particularly in the Social care areas. PCC plan to implement those forms on the new platform at the earliest opportunity. This will save both time and money as only a reskin will be required. There are some projects in place now that also require PCC to use Firmstep alongside CCC. They are: 

1. The reuse of forms in use by the Covid-19 Co-ordination Hub. They sit across both organisations and should be licenced as such.
2. The development of an interim Service Desk system for PCC using Firmstep.

Title: Email Alert Service
Description:
Provision of an automated cloud based "Customer Alert Service" where external stakeholders can subscribe to receive news from Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) on specific topics. The service will allow stakeholders to subscribe to specific range of topics based on DVLA products, services and related areas. 
DVLA information pages will be posted on GOV.UK and DVLA's Digital Services blog, hosted by GDS. Notifications of new/updated content will be input to the Subscriber Alerts Service which will send automatic messages to subscribers, informing them that there is new content available and providing relevant links to updated content pages on GOV.UK and DVLA blog.
